s.text: If U.S. cities were abandoned tomorrow, would the survival rate of our public buildings be better or worse?
If U.S. cities were abandoned tomorrow, would the survival rate of our public buildings be better or worse?
You are not reading the APA's statement on this with your normal discernment.
A little checking might persuade you that these buildings were by no means the norm in the long lost Golden Age of public construction.
Timothy Noah's image of the standard old public building ("") seems to be derived from Mayan or Egyptian pyramids, Greek theaters, the Roman Coliseum, and Notre Dame cathedral.
